application

Class StaffScreenModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.LoginModel
      • application.StaffScreenModel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ManagerScreenModel

    public class StaffScreenModel
extends LoginModel
    This class handles the database interactions needed for the StaffScreenController
    Author:
    jarrod joshua

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection connection 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StaffScreenModel()
      The class constructor checks whether the connection to the database is active, if not the program is closed.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Takes a table number input, finds the corresponding working order and then removes it completely from the system.

      Takes all the order components and then inserts the order into the stored orders (not the current working orders) this is combined with deleting the same order from the current orders therefore having the effect of moving the order from working to stored.

      This takes a table number and queries the database to find the food items saved in that table order and puts them in an ArrayList that can be passed to the listviews and displayed with ease.

      Checks if the input tableNo already has a working order in the database, if it does it updates all fields apart from the time of order, (and the tableNo as that wouldn't make sense).
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Order> searchByComments(java.lang.String group, java.lang.String inputComment)
      Takes a string input which is aimed at finding orders with specified comments, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).

      Takes a date formatted string string which is aimed at finding orders which were registered on a specified date, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders).
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Order> searchByFoodItem(java.lang.String group, java.lang.String inputItem)

      • saveCurrentOrderToDatabase

        void saveCurrentOrderToDatabase(int tableNum,
                                javafx.collections.ObservableList<Food> orderList,
                                double totalBill,
                                java.lang.String specialReqs,
                                java.lang.String comments,
                                java.lang.String isComplete,
                                java.util.Date inDate)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if the input tableNo already has a working order in the database, if it does it updates all fields apart from the time of order, (and the tableNo as that wouldn't make sense). If there is not working order for the inputted table then the record is simply inserted.
        Parameters:
        tableNum -
        orderList -
        totalBill -
        specialReqs -
        comments -
        isComplete -
        inDate -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • moveCurrentOrderToStorage

        void moveCurrentOrderToStorage(int tableNum,
                               javafx.collections.ObservableList<Food> orderList,
                               double totalBill,
                               java.lang.String specialReqs,
                               java.lang.String comments,
                               java.lang.String isComplete,
                               java.util.Date inDate)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException

      • searchByTableNo

        java.util.ArrayList<Order> searchByTableNo(java.lang.String group,
                                           int tableNum)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes a table number integer input, and takes a string input group which determines which table in the database to search ('stored orders' or just 'orders' for the working orders). This method then queries the database to retrieve any orders with the inputted table number
        Parameters:
        group -
        tableNum -
        Returns:
        ArrayList targetOrders: a list of orders which correspond with the inputs to look for
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • saveActivityEntryToDB

        public void saveActivityEntryToDB(java.lang.String user,
                                  java.lang.String act,
                                  java.lang.String timestamp)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes three strings, a username, activity description, and a timestamps, and then registers a new record into the activityLog
        Overrides:
        saveActivityEntryToDB in class LoginModel
        Parameters:
        user - the 'staff'username attribute of the currently logged in user
        act - a string describing what the current user has just done for tracking user activity in th logs managers see
        timestamp - a formatted string containing the date and time of the action
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
